mike amundsen wrote:
> Julian:
> 
> Thanks for helping me clarify. I may be making a lot out of nothing here.
> 
> If I want to support PUT/POST to a resource URL in more than one media
> type (application/atom+xml, application/rss+xml) what is the best way
> to communicate that to clients?

OK, so this is about two different formats essentially containing the 
same information, not two variants (such as "en" and "fr" language 
versions that could exist independently of each other).

I don't think there's a mechanism defined in RFC2616 for doing this.

A good idea may be to extend "Accept" to be able also available as a 
response header, and suggest that servers return it with a 415 
(Unsupported Media Type) status.

BR, Julian
